Package abstraction

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
abstraction.Pawn
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Pawn extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a pawn in a game.
See Also:

    Pawn(Board board, Position pos, Case pawn)
    Creates a new pawn with the specified position and associated player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(Board board, Position pos, Case pawn)
      Creates a new pawn with the specified position and associated player.
      Parameters:
      board - The board where the pawn is placed.
      pos - The current position of the pawn.
      pawn - The number of the pawn.

    • setPossibleMove

      public void setPossibleMove(Set<Position> possibleMove)
      Sets the possible moves for the Pawn.
      Parameters:
      possibleMove - A set of Positions representing the possible moves for the Pawn.

    • finishLine

      public void finishLine()
      Determines the finish line for this pawn based on the associated pawn.

    • possibleMove

      public Set<Position> possibleMove(Board board, Position pos)
      Calculates the possible moves for this pawn given a specific board and position.
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the game board.
      pos - The position from which to calculate possible moves.
      Returns:
      The set of Positions representing the possible moves for the Pawn.

    • updatePos

      public void updatePos(Board board, Position pos)
      Update the pawn's position.
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the game board.
      pos - The new player's position.

    • move

      public boolean move(Board board, Position pos)
      If possible, moves a pawn to a new position on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      pos - The new position for the player.
      Returns:
      true if the move has been made, false otherwise.

    • resetMove

      public void resetMove(Board board)
      Resets the current player's move on the game board, restoring their position to the last recorded position.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.

    • isWinner

      public Boolean isWinner()
      Determines if this pawn is a winner based on its current position.
      Returns:
      true if the pawn's current position is part of the finish line, false otherwise.
